Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of standard Bulgarian 1.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Bulgarian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the BulTreeBank training corpus and using the Bulgarian inflectional lexicon. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~98.8.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of standard Croatian 1.2
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the hr500k training corpus and using the hrLex inflectional lexicon. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~97.6.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of non-standard Croatian 1.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of non-standard Croatian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the hr500k training corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus, the RAPUT corpus and the ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr corpus, using the hrLex inflectional lexicon. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~97.54.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of standard Macedonian 1.0
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Macedonian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the 1984 training corpus (to be published). The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~99.1.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of standard Serbian 1.2
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus and using the srLex inflectional lexicon. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~97.9.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of non-standard Serbian 1.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of non-standard Serbian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the SETimes.SR training corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-sr corpus, the ReLDI-NormTagNER-hr corpus, the hr500k training corpus and the RAPUT corpus, using the srLex inflectional lexicon. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~97.62.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of standard Slovenian 1.4
Description: The model for lemmatisation of standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the ssj500k training corpus and using the Sloleks inflectional lexicon. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~99.7.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.

Corpus: The CLASSLA-StanfordNLP model for lemmatisation of non-standard Slovenian 1.1
Description: The model for lemmatisation of non-standard Slovenian was built with the CLASSLA-StanfordNLP tool by training on the ssj500k training corpus and the Janes-Tag corpus, using the Sloleks inflectional lexicon. These corpora were additionally augmented for handling missing diacritics by repeating parts of the corpora with diacritics removed. The estimated F1 of the lemma annotations is ~98.86.#SEPThe model is available for download from the CLARIN.SI repository.
This model enables lemmatisation of Swedish text following the SUC3 standard.#SEPThe models are available for download from the Swedish Language Bank.
